description:
CIGEN is a tool that finds input ranges that cause high compiler-induced numerical inconsistencies in
numerical programs written in a compiled language. Numerical program behavior may diverge when they
are compiled and ran differently. Many factors, such as different hardware architectures (for example, the
x87 FPU with its 80-bit registers), different compilers, or different optimization flags may cause the results
of floating-point computations to become inconsistent. This kind of inconsistencies are known as
compiler-induced numerical inconsistencies. Given a program with floating-point inputs and an output,
name: CIGEN
